Detailed Description

Class representing states at which the planner must determine the optimal action.

Note that this set of states includes the states given as arguments to policy() as well as all the nonterminal states reachable from those states.

void Planner::DecisionState::child_bound ( const ActionRef &  child,
double  bound 
) [protected]

Informs this DecisionState that one of its child Action objects updated its error bound.

This may change the error bound for this DecisionState, possibly adding this DecisionState to the planner's priority queue or increasing its priority in the queue.

Parameters:
child An Action object in this DecisionState object's action_values container.
bound The error bound for the child.

void Planner::DecisionState::heapify (  )  [protected]

If this DecisionState is in the priority queue of its enclosing Planner, then enforce the heap invariant for the subtree rooted by this DecisionState, assuming that the subtrees rooted at each children is a heap.

Definition at line 578 of file planner.cc.

References m_errorbound, m_heapindex, m_planner, and m_this.

void Planner::DecisionState::initialize (  ) 

Compute the initial value of this state.

Note that this method is separate from the constructor, since otherwise a cycle in the MDP structure might cause the planner to try to create a new DecisionState object for a state in which another DecisionState object is still being constructed. This way, we can update the hash table mapping states of DecisionState objects after construction but before initialization, since the initialization is what causes the cycle.

If this DecisionState is in the priority queue of its enclosing Planner, then move it towards the head of the queue while its error bound is greater than its parent's.

void Planner::DecisionState::zero_bound (  )  [inline]

Resets the bound on Bellman error to zero.

May only be called if this DecisionState is at the head of the priority queue. Removes this DecisionState from the priority queue.

Definition at line 190 of file planner.hh.

Definition at line 262 of file planner.hh.

Member Data Documentation

std::vector<std::pair<TaskRef, ActionRef> > Planner::DecisionState::m_action_values [private]

A mapping from child actions to state-action values, stored as a vector of pairs sorted by the Task pointers.

Invariant: The keys of action_values are precisely the keys in m_model->successor_probabilities(). For each key, the value() method on the corresponding data pointer is equal to the one-step backup of the corresponding state-action given model and the ValueState objects in this planner.

Definition at line 302 of file planner.hh.

Referenced by backup_values(), debug(), initialize(), propagate_MDP_change(), and propagate_value_change().

double Planner::DecisionState::m_errorbound [private]

This nonnegative value is an upper bound on the Bellman error: the difference between the current value of this->value() and the value that would obtain after executing propagate_value_change().

Definition at line 318 of file planner.hh.

Referenced by child_bound(), heapify(), insert_heapify(), and zero_bound().

int Planner::DecisionState::m_heapindex [private]

Indicates the position of this DecisionState in its planner's priority queue, if error > planner.epsilon.

If negative, then this DecisionState is not in the priority queue.

Definition at line 323 of file planner.hh.

Referenced by child_bound(), dequeue(), heapify(), insert_heapify(), zero_bound(), and ~DecisionState().

The set of Task objects that have been received as arguments to observe_MDP_change since the last time propagate_MDP_change() executed.

Definition at line 312 of file planner.hh.

std::pair<TaskRef, ActionRef> Planner::DecisionState::m_max [private]

Invariant: max is the value in action_values that maximizes max.second->value().

Additionally, this->value() equals max.second->value().
